* Suicide is a deliberate act to end one's own life.
* Attempted suicide (AS) is a self-inflicted behaviour that puts life at risk in a real or symbolic way, but with no fatal outcome.  
* Suicidal ideation (SDI) refers to thoughts about wanting to die. They can include passive suicidal ideas (for example, the wish not to wake up or to have an accident) or active suicidal ideas (the person thinks about actions).

* Suicidal: an individual who survives a suicide attempt.
* Suicidal: an individual with suicidal thoughts, expressed or otherwise.
* Suicidal: an individual who has voluntarily taken his own life.

question.title: What does the term 'suicidal' refer to?
question.description: Choose the correct definition of the term 'suicidal'.

option_a.title: An individual who survives a suicide attempt.
option_a.description: This option is incorrect, but it may seem plausible at first glance.

option_b.title: An individual with suicidal thoughts, expressed or otherwise.

option_c.title: An individual who has voluntarily taken his own life.
option_c.description: This option is incorrect, but it is related to the concept of suicide.

option_d.title: Suicide is a deliberate act to end one's own life.
option_d.description: This option is incorrect, but it is a related concept.

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option.
